data.title: Paths to included files gets messed up in MVC
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:49:23.350Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|aessoft-class-autocomplete|AESSoft|0.1.0|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.1.4|
|jquerysnippets|donjayamanne|0.0.1|
|vscode-html-css|ecmel|0.0.30|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.6.0|
|mono-debug|ms-vscode|0.12.0|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.4.1|
|vscode-docker|PeterJausovec|0.0.10|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create asp.net MVC with auth project from yo with aspnet generator
2. Run project with dotnet run (works great, all path to jquery and stuff is correct)
3. Exit and Open it in Code
4. Run debugger, no paths to included javascript/jquery are correct

data.title: Allow getting path of a non-textual file
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Win10

Unless I'm missing something it's impossible to get file object (or simply file path as string) in extension if you have a non-textual file open.

The use case here is that you open let's say an image file, or docx file in vscode, and you want to provide a hotkey for opening this file in your default app associated with given extension. This is a case that I wanted to fix in a small extension sandcastle/vscode-open#2.

For text file it's simple because you could simply get `vscode.window.activeTextEditor.document`, but that's not a case in case of any format unsupported by VSCode.

I tried to get a inspiration using `workbench.action.files.copyPathOfActiveFile` command, so it took me to [`GlobalCopyPathAction`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/e179ec75abb7c3cb225001269561d4a31fe9b673/src/vs/workbench/parts/files/electron-browser/electronFileActions.ts#L89) class, but it uses `editorService` which  I believe is not exposed to extensions API.

data.title: Keep Language mode when reload window after update plugin
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:49:23.350Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|xml|DotJoshJohnson|1.6.1|
|vscode-coffeescript-preview|drewbarrett|0.1.3|
|vscode-great-icons|emmanuelbeziat|1.1.30|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.6.0|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.8.0|
|view-in-browser|qinjia|0.0.3|
|coffeescript-snippets|ronaldloyko|0.1.3|
|vscode-coffeelint|slb235|0.0.2|
|Material-theme|zhuangtongfa|1.0.3|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create new file, write some code and set a language mode (in my case Batch file). The file is unsaved.
2. Update any plugin (in my case C#)
3. Click in reload label and accept message
4. The file is kept but language mode is missed when window reload

data.title: Adaptive abbreviation search for quick open commands
data.body:
Would be nice to adapt the the abbreviations I choose for tasks in Quick Open.  Similar to how [LaunchBar](https://www.obdev.at/products/launchbar/features.html) works.  

e.g. This way I can type launch quick open and type `pu` and enter without getting a Docker Pull command, which I rarely use.

data.title: Scope to folder
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Win10

It would be cool if you could right click on a folder and move the file list scope to that. In that case everything else will be hidden. Very usefull in angular2 or ionic projects. So you would only see files, that you are using at the moment.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6654388/21401804/f01d9f42-c7b5-11e6-8f08-2cf0c57baaa2.png)

data.title: Feature Request: Preview changes of CodeAction before applying them
data.body:
VS provides preview panel for its CodeActions showing diff of the file. Here's the sample:

![](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/873919/21400336/a97b90d4-c7c0-11e6-9002-39cb972d1bf3.gif)

I wonder if we could get something like that in Code :)

data.title: [Windows] Shift+click in task bar does not open new window
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:49:23.350Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

On Windows 10 64-bit.

1. Open VS Code
2. Hold shift and click VS Code in the task bar

Expected result: new VS Code window opens (as per usual Windows shortcut)
Observed result: nothing happens

This is annoying if you have a folder open in one window, and another window showing another file (e.g. to compare/for reference). If you close the folder-based window, you can't open it again until you close all other windows, or replace the existing window, which you then have to open again afterwards.

data.title: Make Javascript intellisense detect inheritance
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.0 (38746938a4ab94f2f57d9e1309c51fd6fb37553d, 2016-12-13T17:38:28.425Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.3.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|JSDocTagComplete|HookyQR|0.0.2|
|html-css-class-completion|Zignd|1.0.3|
|theme-atom-one-dark|andischerer|0.0.1|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.1.0|
|docthis|joelday|0.3.5|
|Angular1|johnpapa|0.1.16|
|Angular2|johnpapa|1.0.2|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.5.3|
|js-atom-grammar|ms-vscode|0.1.10|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|4.0.2|
|bootstrap-3-snippets|wcwhitehead|0.0.8|

---

Hello,
I would love it if VS Code's Javascript intellisense was able to detect inheritance.  Please let me know if there is a way to accomplish this today through jsdoc comments or anything like that.  I have tried all kinds of different ways to get VS Code to detect it (definitions like below, @augments, @extends jsdoc comments, etc) and have not gotten anything to work.

```
As an example, when inheriting like this:
function BaseClass() {
  this.foo = 'bar';
}
BaseClass.prototype.baz = function () { }

function InheritedClass() {
  BaseClass.call(this);
}
InheritedClass.prototype = Object.create(BaseClass.prototype);
InheritedClass.prototype.constructor = InheritedClass;
```
Would like the intellisense for new InheritedClass(). to show 'foo' and 'baz' as properties/methods for InheritedClass in Intellisense.

data.title: Git file history temp file is lost after switching
data.body:
- VSCode Version:  1.8.1
- OS Version: Fedora 22

Steps to Reproduce:

In file explorer, right click and Git: view file history then select a commit and View file contents. This will open a temp file with that revision, but if you switch to another file it is lost and an error is shown prompting to create the file because it does not exist.

I was hoping it would keep the file in the Opened editors top pane, because i can perfectly create a new empty file with Ctrl-n and not save it to disk and be able to switch to it after opening another file.

Thanks.

data.title: Using the define keybinding button breaks in conjnction with \ character
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: OSX El Capitan

Steps to Reproduce:

1. On Mac open Code>Preferences>Keyboard Shortcuts
2. Click the Blue "Define Keybinding" Button in the bottom right hand corner
3. Define a keybinding that ends with the \ character such as ctrl+alt+cmd+\
4. Notice that the \ character is not properly escaped, and instead escapes the last " character in the object that is added to keybindings.json, causing the strings to not be recognized correctly.

data.title: ⌘+P does not toggle"Go to file" any more on OSX

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: OSX 10.12.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Press ⌘+P
2. Test input does not show up

But triggering it using _Go->Go to file..._ works.

data.title: Configurable behavior of page-up (cursorPageUp) and page-down (cursorPageDown)
data.body:
I haven't found a way how to change the behavior of page-up and page-down to the following:

  * when I hit page-up / page-down, the cursor won't visually move the line, but the content scrolls up or down.
  * this basically means, that hitting page-up and then page-down brings me to the same "view" as it was before (unless I hit start / end of document)

Currently when I press page-up / page-down the page doesn't scroll, but the cursor moves up or down first (then after hitting page-up / page-down again it scrolls finally). I'm not used to this behavior and would like to change that.

Not sure I expressed this correctly, I just would like to have the option to control this.

data.title: Multiple File Manager
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Linux

Currently in vscode you can't select more then one file at a time. For example if you want to move multiple files in another folder you have to do it one by one or use the OS file manager. It would be great to have this as well in vscode.

data.title: Update LICENSE.txt
data.body:
This is the correct writing for **MIT License**.
With this, you will get MIT licenses tab beside contributors tab.

data.title: Freezing on update / install
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Win 10 pro

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  New Install from download
2.  Click "Update Now" on pop up in program

When I click the update now pop up it takes me to the 'Preparing to Install' dialog box and freezes.  No dialog appears in the box and hovering over it only shows the windows loading cursor.  Only way to close the box is through task manager.  The same happens if I download the latest version and try to install that way.

data.title: Display file while moving with arrows in the explorer
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Linux

There is a feature from sublime, when selecting a file in the sidebar (click only once) and then by using the arrows to navigate to the next file displayed in the sidebar, the content of the file changes the next instant. In vscode you need to press enter after focusing on the file.
This is really helpful when wanting to check small thing in many files. Especially in git diff, if there are small changes you can navigate fast just with the arrows.

data.title: Hot Exit forgets language mode for unsaved files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. File > New File
2. Select Language Mode > Change to HTML (or whatever)
3. Make any edits to file
4. Quit VSCode
5. Open VSCode

The Untitled-1 file reopens, but the Language Mode is reset to Plain Text.  VSCode should remember the Language Mode that was set.

data.title: Change order of Diff extensions.

Fixes #17672

Resolves visual issue with associated images.

Has been tested locally and has the expected behavior.

data.title: Html Formatter not working when use style attribute

data.title: [FR] use the Terminal as a console output
data.body:
I would really love to see the possibility to use a terminal as console output.
The reason is that we would benefit from all amazing features from xterm.js

Obviously one is colour output.

There are actually 2 ways to do that:
- give the possibility to run a command inside the Terminal while listening for stdout, stderr, close. Also this would allow stdin! Which would be amazing from for extensions!
- allow to "append" text to the console without it executing a command.

I can give more details on what i am trying to achieve if necessary

data.title: codefix key-chord doesn't work when  the caret is at the end of the
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.x insider's preview
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. create a situation for a codefix
2. observe a piece of code with a wiggly line and a codefix icon
3. place the caret at the very end of the wiggly line
4. hit `Ctrl + .` (current combination for engaging codefixes)
5. observe nothing happens

expected: a popup with codefix choices should be displayed

data.title: Replace: Cannot read property 'getValue' of null

2. pin it

data.title: [Fedora 25] Release notes window doesn't cover entire page
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7, 1.8
- OS Version: Fedora 25

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Check for new version
2. See the release notes page

The release notes doesn't cover entire window, but only a quarter. See the picture.

![schermata del 2016-12-21 14-50-25](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5095918/21391650/d8a641e4-c78c-11e6-82e0-946edf4636ac.png)
